questions.text: What did Toby tell the reporter he was going for when writing Bartlet's final State of the Union address?
questions.explanation:
Pith.

	Toby told the reporter he was going for pith, but President Bartlet told Leo toward the end of the episode that the length of the speech was determined by how long he could stand on his own two feet.

questions.text: How many U.S. contractors were captured by Zalaya in Bolivia?
questions.explanation:
8.

	Zalaya supporters thought they were really CIA agents, but Kate confirmed for the President that they were just U.S. contractors.

questions.text: Who was the picture of that Leo noticed on the wall outside the Oval Office?
questions.explanation:
Thomas Paine.

	Leo noticed the picture for the first time while he waited to speak to the President. Debbie thought it was Nathan Hale, but Leo said it was Thomas Paine.

questions.text: What new name did Charlie come up with for the Earned Income Tax credit?
questions.explanation:
Poor tax.

	Annabeth told Charlie he should get something shorter and zippier if he wanted Congress to support funding for it. Charlie came up with the poor tax.

questions.text: Before going to work for Russell, did Will admit to making fun of him?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Will was talking to Leo about what the President and Leo saw in Bob Russell when they appointed him Vice President. Will said he hadn't sold his soul to the Devil, but he thought he might have rented it out.

questions.text: Who was the only person able to stay for Leo's welcome back party?
questions.explanation:
Leo's intern.

	Everyone showed up at his office before he arrived, but they were all called out due to different emergencies. Before Leo excused his intern, he wrote 365 on the white board.

No.

	Kate and CJ were talking about the U.S. contractors that were being held and CJ asked Kate if she had ever been held hostage. She said no, but she had held people and twenty-four hours was a long time.

questions.text: Who did Toby say this to, "Eliza Doolittle gets to tutor Henry Higgins"?
questions.explanation:
Annabeth.

	Toby wanted Annabeth to tutor Abbey on the rituals of a Nascar race. When Toby made the reference to Eliza Doolittle and Henry Higgens, Annabeth said she would get her redneck to snob dictionary out.

questions.text: Was Abbey happy to be kissed by the winner of the Nascar race she attended?
questions.explanation:
No.

	When Toby and Annabeth watched Abbey being kissed by the Nascar winner, Toby asked her if Abbey knew she was going to be kissed. Annabeth didn't understand what was so bad about being kissed by a Nascar driver.

questions.text: When the President called everyone back for Leo's meeting, who said they were on a date?
questions.explanation:
Annabeth.

	Annabeth told Will she always had a date and Kate said that this meeting wasn't interrupting any part of her evening. The President called them all in to work so Leo could talk to them and get their ideas on how they could make the last year of the Bartlet administration better.
